name: cowpea
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] a plant of the bean family grown in warm regions for food and to improve the soil : Cover crops such as rye, soybean, cowpea, or clover can be tilled in as a green manure. Cowpea is widely used as animal feed, but it also attracts many viruses and pests.
[ C or U ] the seed of this plant that is pale with a black spot, and is eaten as food: These beans are from the same family as cowpeas. The everyday food in Africa from the sixteenth century included rice, beans, cowpea, millet, and couscous. Compare
black-eyed bean
More examplesFewer examplesThe black bean is of South American origin although other species are already known in Europe, such as the cowpea.
